intro: Morisonia pringlei, commonly known as the Hawaiian spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble spider-like structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, Morisonia pringlei is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
